intro: Hemigraphis lamiifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican mint, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink, arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage. Hemigraphis lamiifolia is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
